meanings.definition: To provide with a quality or ability
meanings.sent1: She will endue her students with knowledge and skills.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will endue the students with the ability to solve complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The magician endued the rabbit with the power to speak.
meanings.sent4: The mentor endued her protege with confidence like a superhero's cape.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl endued the young owl with the secrets of the forest.

meanings.definition: To invest or endow with a particular quality or attribute
meanings.sent1: The artist will endue the painting with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent2: He decided to endue his character with kindness and compassion.
meanings.sent3: The chef endued the dish with a magical flavor that made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her words endued him with courage as if she had given him a shield.
meanings.sent5: The sun endues the sky with a golden hue at sunset.
